entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot This Weekend for the North Slope and Arctic Coast... A dry and hot chinook wind will develop across the Brooks Range late Friday into Sunday. Warmth may linger into Monday with high temps across the arctic plain into the 80s F and upper 70s along the arctic coast, Saturday and Sunday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:28AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot Over Eastern Northern Alaska Friday through Monday... Temperatures are expected to climb into the mid 80s F range over the Interior and 70s-80s F over the eastern North Slope beginning Friday, with 90s F possible by the weekend across the Yukon Flats and E Interior. In addition, a chinook wind will develop Friday near the Alaska Range continue into Sunday. These warm and dry

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 11:21PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Along The Coast This Weekend... A strong weather will move through the Bering Sea this weekend and bring gale force southerly winds and elevated water levels to coastal areas.
